paper.title: How to construct pseudorandom permutations from single pseudorandom functions
paper.venue: Theory and Application of Cryptographic Techniques
paper.abstract: The paper examines permutation generators which are designed using four rounds of the Data Encryption Standard and a single pseudorandom function. We have proved that such generators are pseudorandom only if the pseudorandom function is used internally at least five times. The proof is given using two different approaches: deterministic and probabilistic. Some cryptographic implications are also discussed.
